com.example.federico.wearableui.model.finger

Class Finger

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.federico.wearableui.model.finger.Finger
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IFinger

    public class Finger
extends java.lang.Object
implements IFinger
    This class models the user's Finger, by keeping track of its orientation. Such orientation is used as an input source for the Cursor, that can be moved around on the Viewport accordingly to it. This class is also a Singleton, since there only has to be one instance of it.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void calibrate(Quaternion calibration)
      Sets the Finger calibration Quaternion.
      Quaternion getCurrentCalibration()
      Returns the starting position of the Finger, expressed in a coordinate system that is not relative to the user.
      float getFingerPitch()
      Returns the pitch of the Finger based on the user's coordinate system.
      float getFingerYaw()
      Returns the yaw of the Finger based on the user's coordinate system.
      static IFinger getInstance()
      Returns the Singleton instance.
      Quaternion getOrientation()
      Returns the orientation of the Finger, expressed in the user's coordinate system.

      Updates the Finger orientation.

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static IFinger getInstance()
        Returns the Singleton instance.
        Returns:
        the Singleton instance.

      • updateOrientation

        public void updateOrientation(Quaternion orientationUpdate)
        Description copied from interface: IFinger
        Updates the Finger orientation.
        Specified by:
        updateOrientation in interface IFinger
        Parameters:
        orientationUpdate - a Quaternion that represents the new orientation of the Finger. This orientation isn't relative to the user's coordinate system, but by calculating the difference between it and the calibration Quaternion it's possible to obtain the Finger orientation based on the user's coordinate system.

      • calibrate

        public void calibrate(Quaternion calibration)
        Description copied from interface: IFinger
        Sets the Finger calibration Quaternion.
        Specified by:
        calibrate in interface IFinger
        Parameters:
        calibration - a Quaternion that represents the starting position of the Finger. This orientation isn't relative to the user's coordinate system, but it's used as a starting point. By calculating the difference between the future orientations provided and this one, it is possible to obtain the Finger orientation based on the user's coordinate system.

      • getOrientation

        public Quaternion getOrientation()
        Description copied from interface: IFinger
        Returns the orientation of the Finger, expressed in the user's coordinate system.
        Specified by:
        getOrientation in interface IFinger
        Returns:
        a Quaternion representing the Finger orientation.

      • getCurrentCalibration

        public Quaternion getCurrentCalibration()
        Description copied from interface: IFinger
        Returns the starting position of the Finger, expressed in a coordinate system that is not relative to the user. This is used to calculate the current orientation of the Finger relative to the user's coordinate system.
        Specified by:
        getCurrentCalibration in interface IFinger
        Returns:
        a Quaternion representing the Finger starting orientation.

      • getFingerPitch

        public float getFingerPitch()
        Description copied from interface: IFinger
        Returns the pitch of the Finger based on the user's coordinate system.
        Specified by:
        getFingerPitch in interface IFinger
        Returns:
        the degrees of the pitch angle of the Finger, relative to the user's coordinate system.

      • getFingerYaw

        public float getFingerYaw()
        Description copied from interface: IFinger
        Returns the yaw of the Finger based on the user's coordinate system.
        Specified by:
        getFingerYaw in interface IFinger
        Returns:
        the degrees of the yaw angle of the Finger, relative to the user's coordinate system.
